Articles.Content:
Thank you for the lightning fast response!

The density curve not working is indeed due to my own stupidity. The addition of that flag would be awesome, the effect i have for ignition is way over the top and looks weird when used while the throttle is down.

Allright so the stock sparks are off limits. How should i go about copying that with smokescreen? The "Stretch" render mode doesn't work it seems (particles are generated and appear in the counter in the UI, but are invisible), and i have no clue what shader, if any, i could use to make particles "trail" like that

2.6.2 Add lengthScale & velocityScale curves. Some minor fix like using the game mach value (so mach will scale with the body atmo now)

Download : SmokeScreen-2.6.2.0.zip

Edited June 4, 2015 by Blacks
And ? Do you have a bug ?

well i have nothing special to complain only i see this from time to time in debug panel, i don't know if is normal or not, at this point i doo a lot parsing log data to identifie other problem, i seen is a new release, i install i pull data from log & i post it

AddonLoader: Instantiating addon 'PersistentEmitterManager' from assembly 'SmokeScreen'

[smokeScreen PersistentEmitterManager] : OnDestroy

how i say i not know if is normal or not but when i see OnDestroy it capture my atention, if is normal i will ignore
It is normal. I should remove some of those since they are not needed anymore.
Looks like there's a couple of problems with last release of KOSMOS URM engines, see here (I believe "upstream" wildcard .cfg may need to be patched, hehe)

Hello!

My SmokeScreen implementation has stopped working. The number of particles shows as 0 even though I set it at 8,000. I have uninstalled and erased KSP 1.0.2 and plugins completely and installed again with only SmokeScreen and Toolbar, with no luck. The menu shows the "Open ModelMultiParticlePersistFX UI: list as empty" as opposed to before where it would show all the parts that contributed to smoke effects.

What is happening?
You removed the mods that brings the smokescreen configs like "hotrockets!" ?

2.6.3 Remove lengthScale & velocityScale curves (a Unity limitation made them not that usefull).

Rescale effect when used with the ProceduralSRB of Procedural Parts

new initalVelocityOffsetMaxRadius curve that adds its value to the randomInitalVelocityOffsetMaxRadius value.

Download : SmokeScreen-2.6.3.0.zip

Edited June 14, 2015 by sarbian

2.6.2 Remove lengthScale & velocityScale curves (a Unity limitation made them not that usefull).

Rescale effect when used with the ProceduralSRB of Procedural Parts

new initalVelocityOffsetMaxRadius curve that adds its value to the randomInitalVelocityOffsetMaxRadius value.

Download : SmokeScreen-2.6.3.0.zip

Why is the changelog for V 2.6.2 when the version is 2.6.3? or is it meant as "changes from 2.6.2" (to 2.6.3)?

2.6.4 New sizeClamp Curve that adds itself to the sizeClamp value

Download : SmokeScreen-2.6.4.0.zip

Felger contribution :

2.6.5 add randConeEmit, xyForce and zForce curves

The last update completely destroyed HR configs,i don't say it's bad thing just more work.

P.S.can you please update "Spoiler: Default Config"also.

thank you
In RO also every effect now looks weird, I guess there will be fixes during the next days though

Sorry, that's my fault, forgot to flag xyForce and zForce as multiplicative instead of additive. Here's a fixed smokescreen .dll, the Pull Request with the fix is in, hopefully Sarbian can get my fix in soon.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ccvvrgf09a257bb/SmokeScreen_dll_2.6.5a.zip?dl=0
Seem to be getting smoke whilst in space, as reported a few pages back. The current update plus the .dll fix posted above still produce it, though i don't see a circle pattern anymore.

2.6.6 with the fix is out.

Subcidal : this is a problem with the configs you use, not SmokeScreen.

In RO also every effect now looks weird, I guess there will be fixes during the next days though

Yeah, twas my fault. Updated dll is out, download 2.6.6

Yeah, twas my fault. Updated dll is out, download 2.6.6

Ah, ty for the quick reply

With the latest release (2.6.6), the engine exhaust seems to be coming out through the engine as if the point of origin is inside the engine (with Laztek Launch pack and Realism Overhaul)

I'm not sure if this mod is causing this though as the latest update fixed my other problem

kendoka15 : most likely a config problem with the new RO config. They will improve with time

2.6.7 is out and fix an error spam when an active engine got out of physic range

I'm not 100% sure if this is me being silly or a genuine problem, but I can't seem to find the SmokeScreen menu. If I recall correctly, it should be an app in the app bar during a flight scene, correct? If that's the case, it doesn't seem to be working for me. :/

I'm not 100% sure if this is me being silly or a genuine problem, but I can't seem to find the SmokeScreen menu. If I recall correctly, it should be an app in the app bar during a flight scene, correct? If that's the case, it doesn't seem to be working for me. :/

Well,you need to install Toolbar,and set the icon to be visible.
